channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: As the search for victims continues, questions mount about weather warnings
item.description: Dozens of people have died and scores of others are unaccounted for in the Texas Hill Country following massive flash flooding. As the search for victims continues, questions mount about weather warnings.

item.title: Surprising ways that alpaca farmers are managing heat stress on their animals
item.description: The impact of severe heat waves on livestock is creating new challenges for those trying to manage the animals stress; alpaca farmers have surprising new methods.

item.title: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visits White House to discuss Gaza ceasefire
item.description: President Emeritus of the Council on Foreign Relations Richard Haass discusses Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's visit to the White House Monday to meet with President Trump, who is pressing the Israel leader for a ceasefire agreement and an end to the war in Gaza.

item.title: What works about road trip movies centered on women?
item.description: NPR's Pien Huang, Avery Keatley and Bob Mondello explore what works about road trip movies centered on women.

item.title: A new report offers insights for U.K. efforts to improve polluted water supply
item.description: A new report offers insights for U.K. efforts to improve areas with polluted water supplies.

item.title: The Dalai Lama turns 90 amid reaction to succession announcement
item.description: The Dalai Lama turns 90 on Sunday and celebrates his birthday amid reaction to his recent announcement that he, not China, will choose his successor.

item.title: Cuts to HIV research funding in the US impacts progress towards ending the epidemic
item.description: How will the Trump administration's cuts to HIV research impact the progress that's been made towards ending the epidemic in the U.S.?

item.title: We need each other, say artisans at Smithsonian Folklife Festival
item.description: NPR's Pien Huang takes a journey to the Smithsonian Folklife Festival to hear from youth voices about how they're telling the story of America on the 4th of July.

item.title: Madison McFerrin describes the power of finding her own voice and sound
item.description: Madison McFerrin, daughter of renowned musician Bobby McFerrin, describes her new album Scorpio and the power of finding her own voice and sound.

item.title: Heat and wildfire smoke affect birth outcomes, according to a new study
item.description: Heat and wildfire smoke affect birth outcomes, according to a new study of women in Los Angeles.
